data.title: Best Law Schools In Washington State
data.meta_description: Discover the top 3 law schools in Washington here. Our experts cover key details about the top law programs in the state and what each school has to offer.
data.text:
Reviewed by:

David Merson

Former Head of Pre-Law Office, Northeastern University, & Admissions Officer, Brown University

Reviewed: 7/8/24

â

Welcome to our exploration of law schools in Washington State, where aspiring lawyers can find a blend of prestigious institutions and specialized programs tailored to a variety of legal interests.Â

â

This article offers an overview of the top three legal education institutions in Washington, highlighting each institution's unique strengths. It discusses the University of Washington's specialization in intellectual property and environmental law, Gonzaga University's focus on social justice, and Seattle University's innovative methods.

This guide, tailored for prospective lawyers, assists in selecting the right legal education in Washington State, including law schools in Seattle. It encompasses a thorough understanding of academic theory, hands-on experience, and areas of specialized law, guiding you in making a well-informed decision about your legal studies.

Top Law Schools In Washington State

Law School Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA University of Washington #48 34.7% 164 3.74 Gonzaga University #120 64.2% 154 3.48 Seattle University #114 59% 157 3.49

The list of law schools in Washington State features a selection of distinguished institutions, each celebrated for their unique specializations and areas of expertise.Â

The University of Washington School of Law is recognized for its emphasis on intellectual property and environmental law. Gonzaga University School of Law distinguishes itself with a strong commitment to social justice and public service.Â

Lastly, Seattle University School of Law is acclaimed for its innovative and student-focused approach. Together, these schools contribute significantly to the state's educational offerings, equipping future legal experts with comprehensive and practical training in various aspects of law.

If youâre looking for an online law school, Washington State has options for you, providing flexibility and accessibility in pursuing a legal education. Or, you may consider hybrid programs that blend online coursework with in-person experiences to get the best of both worlds. Keep reading to learn more.Â

University of Washington School of Law

Law School Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate University of Washington #48 34.7% 164 3.74 94%

The University of Washington School of Law stands as a prominent legal education institution nestled in the bustling city of Seattle, Washington.Â

Renowned for its exceptional and comprehensive programs in intellectual property law and environmental law, the school draws a diverse array of students from across the nation. Its curriculum is tailored to provide a deep understanding of these specialties, integrating both theoretical and practical aspects of legal study.Â

The school also excels in legal research, offering numerous opportunities for students to engage in cutting-edge legal inquiries and projects. Moreover, its dedication to societal impact is highlighted by numerous clinics and outreach programs, fostering the growth of community-focused legal professionals.

This multifaceted approach to legal education and its notable achievements in both academia and community engagement solidify its esteemed position within the legal community.

Gonzaga University School of Law

Law School Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate Gonzaga University #120 64.2% 154 3.48 69.3%

Gonzaga University School of Law, located in Spokane, Washington, is a well-regarded institution known for its strong commitment to social justice and public service law. The school offers a robust legal education with a focus on practical skills, ensuring graduates are well-prepared for their legal careers.Â

Despite the lack of available data on its bar pass rate, Gonzaga Law is recognized for its personalized approach to teaching, with a low student-to-faculty ratio fostering an environment of close mentorship and individual attention.Â

The school also provides diverse clinical programs and externship opportunities, allowing students to gain hands-on experience in various legal settings. Additionally, its initiatives in community engagement and ethical legal practice reflect its mission to produce competent and compassionate lawyers dedicated to serving their communities.

Seattle University School of Law

Law School Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate Seattle University #114 59% 157 3.49 89.7%

Located in the vibrant city of Seattle, Washington, this law school stands out for its forward-thinking and student-focused legal education. Seattle University School of Law is celebrated for its diverse and welcoming community while offering specialized courses in areas like social justice, business law, and the evolving field of technology law.Â

Seattle Law School excels in its clinical programs, providing valuable, hands-on legal experiences that prepare students effectively for the real world. This, along with its dedicated faculty and an all-encompassing curriculum, ensures that students are thoroughly equipped for a prosperous career in law.Â

Seattle University Law School places a strong emphasis on ethical practice and community involvement, underlining its commitment to nurturing not only skilled legal professionals but also conscientious leaders. This approach is geared towards producing graduates who are dedicated to making a positive societal impact.
